intro: Paullinia leiocarpa, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a member of the Sapindaceae family. It is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and yellowish-orange flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a rough, green, egg-shaped drupe that turns red when mature. The botanical features of Paullinia leiocarpa make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
